cause.description:
http://drugwarfacts.org/addictiv.htm
Here are the facts. Alcohol is just as illegal to persons under 21 in the united states as Marijuana is~ however, the penalties are far worse, especially on our campus.
Alcohol use, unlike Marijuana use, can result in Sexual Assault, Overdose Deaths, and forms of Domestic Violence.
Although Marijuana has a risk of mental addiction, Alcohol has the potential to become physically addictive, causing the user to need the substance.
Although alcohol is a far more leathal substance than Marijuana, it is considered less of a threat because it is more "socially acceptable".
1. Equal Punishment
cause.mission: To educate the public about the relative harms of alcohol and marijuana and to raise public awareness of the fact that marijuana is objectively less harmful than alcohol to both the user and society.
